medical_history.chief_complaint: Sudden onset right epigastric/right upper quadrant pain
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain began at midnight the day of admission and has been experienced off and on for the past year. The pain is sharp, constant, and radiates around her right flank towards her shoulder. The patient reports episodes of similar pain approximately 3 times per month that are generally self-limited and last only a few hours. The current episode was preceded by eating "cup of noodle" soup around 7pm the night before, with the pain starting 5 hours later. She also experienced two episodes of non-bilious emesis related to this pain.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension; Past surgical history includes C-section, laparoscopic appendectomy, and surgery for a hole in the heart when several months old.
